May I, in my future lives, attain bodhi. If there are sentient beings who commit the ten evil deeds, such as killing, due to these causes and conditions, they will fall into hell;
If they hear my name and single-mindedly chant it, they will all attain accomplishment in the ten wholesome paths, not fall into evil destinies, and reach bodhi.
The third great vow:
May I, in my future lives, attain bodhi. If there are sentient beings who are not free, bound by others, or imprisoned, fettered, shackled, whipped, beaten, or even sentenced to death;
If they hear my name and single-mindedly chant it, by this power, they will all be liberated from their calamities, and reach bodhi.
The fourth great vow:

I vow that in my future lives, when I attain enlightenment, if there are sentient beings who commit various evil deeds, do not believe in the Three Jewels, follow false views, turn their backs on the true principles, delight in heretical groups, slander the Buddha's scriptures, saying they are not the words of the sages, respectfully accept and uphold the scriptures of non-Buddhist paths, either doing it themselves or teaching others, and are all deluded, they will fall into the hells without any hope of escape. Even if they are reborn as humans, they will be born in places with the eight difficulties, far from the right path, blind without the eyes of wisdom;

If such people hear my name, single-mindedly chant it, and by the power of this, when they are about to die, they are mindful and present, liberated from various difficulties, are always born in central countries, receive supreme bliss, and attain enlightenment.

May I, in my future lives, when I attain enlightenment, have a body like a lapis lazuli, clear inside and out, with vast and radiant light filling all directions, adorned with a net of flames surpassing the sun and moon, in the dark places between the Iron Encircling Mountains, where beings can see each other, or in this world, wandering in the dark night, may all beings who see my light be enlightened and be able to do various things according to their wishes.
The third great vow:
May I, in my future lives, when I attain enlightenment, with immeasurable and boundless wisdom and skillful means, enable all beings to enjoy inexhaustible resources.
